title: Part. motion, given v(t) and x(0) part - b

content.description: For 0 ≤ t ≤ 12 , a particle moves along the x-axis. The velocity of the particle at time t is given by v(t) = cos(π/6t) . The particle is at position x = -2 at time t = 0.
content.question: Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression that gives the total distance traveled by the particle from time t = 0 to time t = 6.

frqParts.text: Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression that gives the total distance traveled by the particle from time t = 0 to time t = 6.

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
